Background

Mazen focuses on computer vision, deep learning, and data science. He worked at the Center for Genome Research & Bio-computing (CGRB) as a Computational Data Scientist. He graduated from Oregon State University with a Bachelor of Science (B.S.) degree in Computer Science Applied in Artificial Intelligence; with a minor in Actuarial Science. He worked at CGRB as a Lead GPU Computational Researcher during his senior year at OSU. He was the Vice-President of OSU ML/AI Club (known as OSU AI Club now) for 2017-2018 & 2018-2019.

Loading the data just for you.

Studies

Fall 2020

Mazen will be a Teaching Assistance (TA) for X, and he will be taking the following courses:

  • TOPICS IN GRAPHICS AND VISION: ST/ DIGITAL IMAGE PROCESSING (CS 559)
  • ST/ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE: ST/ DATA VISUALIZATION FOR ML (CS 539)
  • MACHINE LEARNING (CS 534)

Uses This

Mailing lists

  • Hacker News Digest: Best way to know about the top things in tech every week.
  • KDnuggets News: Shares top articles about Data Science every other day.
  • The Batch: Presents the most important AI events and perspective in a curated, easy-to-read report for engineers and business leaders every Wednesday.

Podcasts

  • This Week in ML and AI: Sam interviews people who are working in industry and academia. Great resource to be aware of what’s happening in the world and how smart people solve them.
  • Artificial Intelligence with Lex Fridman: Lex interviews people from different background of science and influencers.
  • Machine Learning Street Talk: Lex interviews people from different background of science and influencers.

Home Machine

  • Hardware:

My Stack

Automation

  • Simple Scripts: Bash
  • Complicated Scripts: Python

Programs

  • Text-editor: VS Code mainly but trying to get used to Vim
  • Music App: Spotify
  • Terminal: terminator
  • Browser: Chrome
  • Data Recorder: Notion
  • Task Manager (for personal use): Todoist

  • Cloud File Storage Service: Google Drive
  • Password Manager: LastPass

Development

  • Data Analysis:
    • Machine Learning: scikit-learn for out of the box tools, TensorFlow for scalable projects for deployment, and PyTorch for fun projects
    • Computer Vision: OpenCV
  • Web Development
    • Full-stack: MERN - MongoDB, ExpressJS, ReactJS, and NodeJS
    • Others: EJS, jQuery, and Bootstrap, Flask

My Reading List

2020

  1. Soccermatics: Mathematical Adventures in the Beautiful Game by David Sumpter (in-process)
  2. A PhD Is Not Enough!: A Guide to Survival in Science by Peter J. Feibelman (in-process)
  3. Mastery by Robert Greene (in-process)
  4. How to Read a Book: The Classic Guide to Intelligent Reading by Mortimer J. Adler and Charles Van Doren (in-process)
  5. Genius At Play: The Curious Mind of John Horton Conway by Siobhan Roberts
  6. Surely You’re Joking, Mr. Feynman! (Adventures of a Curious Character) by Richard P. Feynman and Ralph Leighton
  7. Why We Sleep: Unlocking the Power of Sleep and Dreams by Matthew Walker PhD
  8. The Power of Full Engagement: Managing Energy, Not Time, Is the Key to High Performance and Personal Renewal by Jim Loehr and Tony Schwartz
  9. Astrophysics for People in a Hurry by Neil deGrasse Tyson
  10. Confident Data Skills: Master the Fundamentals of Working with Data and Supercharge Your Career (Confident Series) by Kirill Eremenko
  11. Principles of Data Science: Learn the techniques and math you need to start making sense of your data by Sinan Ozdemir

Long-readings

  1. Gödel, Escher, Bach: An Eternal Golden Braid by Douglas R. Hofstadter
  2. Mathematics for the Nonmathematician by Morris Kline
  3. The Intelligent Investor: The Definitive Book on Value Investing. A Book of Practical Counsel (Revised Edition) by Benjamin Graham and Jason Zweig

Previously Read

  1. Can’t Hurt Me: Master Your Mind and Defy the Odds by David Goggins
  2. Rewire: Change Your Brain to Break Bad Habits, Overcome Addictions, Conquer Self-Destruc tive Behavior by Richard O’Connor
  3. Algorithms to Live By: The Computer Science of Human Decisions by Brian Christian and Tom Griffiths
  4. The ONE Thing: The Surprisingly Simple Truth Behind Extraordinary Results by Gary Keller and Jay Papasan
  5. Getting Things Done: The Art of Stress-Free Productivity by David Allen
  6. Einstein: His Life and Universe by Walter Isaacson
  7. Gifted Hands 20th Anniversary Edition: The Ben Carson Story by Ben Carson M.D.
  8. The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People: Powerful Lessons in Personal Change by Stephen R. Covey

List 100

Things Mazen wants to do before he dies. Please let him know if you have any recommendations. Inspired by Chip Huyen.

  1. Live in another country (US)
  2. Get an affiliation on Twitch
  3. Get a Masters Degree (in-process)
  4. Become one of the authors of a paper at a top-tier conference
  5. Publish more than 25 posts
  6. Publish a Python package
  7. Publish an NPM package
  8. Get a PhD Degree
  9. Live in Japan
  10. Learn Japanese
  11. Become the first author of a paper at a top-tier conference
  12. Teach a course
  13. Teach a graduate-level course
  14. Write a book
  15. Get a patent
  16. Start a company
  17. Start an non-profit organization
